About me Marie Curie Project Research

Marie Curie Project

Marie Skłodowska-Curie Project

This website summarizes the Marie Skłodowska-Curie Individual Fellowship of Janine George “A materials informatics approach to the Pauling rules” with the acronym “JG-GH-UCLouvain” and the project number “837910” . The research was done at the UCLouvain in Belgium from October 2019 to April 2021 under the supervision of Geoffroy Hautier.

Summary

Publications in Connection to the Project

  1. M. Markov, L. Alaerts, H. P. C. Miranda, G. Petretto, W. Chen, J. George, E. Bousquet, P. Ghosez, G.-M. Rignanese, G. Hautier, PNAS, 2021, DOI: 10.1073/pnas.2026020118

  2. J. George, G. Hautier, “The chemist versus the machine: traditional knowledge versus machine learning techniques”, Trends in Chemistry, 2021, DOI:10.1016/j.trechm.2020.10.007

  3. R. Hanus, J. George, M. Wood, A. Bonkowski, Y. Cheng, D. L. Abernathy, M. E. Manley, G. Hautier, G. J. Snyder, R. P. Hermann, Materials Today Physics, 2021, 100344

  4. J George, G Hautier, AP Bartók, G Csányi, VL Deringer, “Combining phonon accuracy with high transferability in Gaussian approximation potential models”, J. Chem. Phys., 2020, 153, 044104

  5. R. Nelson, C. Ertural, J. George, V. Deringer, G. Hautier, R. Dronskowski, “LOBSTER: Local Orbital Projections, Atomic Charges, and Chemical Bonding Analysis from Projector-Augmented-Wave-Based DFT”, J Comput Chem. 2020, 41, 1931-1940.
  6. D. Waroquiers, J. George, M. Horton, S. Schenk, K. Persson, G.-M. Rignanese, X. Gonze, G. Hautier, “ChemEnv: A Fast and Robust Coordination Environment, Identification Tool”, Acta Cryst. B 2020, 76, 683.
  7. J. George, D. Waroquiers, D. Di Stefano, G. Petretto, G.-M. Rignanese, G. Hautier, “The Limited Predictive Power of the Pauling Rules”, Angew. Chem. Int. Ed. 2020, 59, 7569

Talks/Posters Connected to the Project

  1. January 2020: “Accelerated Analysis and Discovery of Materials”, Invited Talk in the Solid-State Seminar of the Inorganic Chemistry Laboratory at University of Oxford, UK.
  2. November 2019. “Reassessing Pauling’s Rules”, Contributed talk at the 15th German Conference on Cheminformatics, Mainz, Germany.
  3. September 2019. “Reassessing Pauling’s Rules”, Poster at the Symposium on Theoretical Chemistry, University of Rostock, Germany.
  4. August 2019. “Return of the Pauling Rules”, Science Slam Contribution at the European Crystallographic Meeting in Vienna, Austria.
  5. August 2019. “Reassessing Pauling’s Rules”, Poster at the European Crystallographic Meeting in Vienna, Austria.
  6. July 2019. “Accelerated Analysis and Discovery of Materials”, Invited Talk at the CECAM workshop “Accelerating material discovery by smart high-throughput computations” at the University of Liverpool, UK.
  7. February 2019. “Reassessing Pauling’s Rules”, Poster at the 28th ATC in Frankfurt, Germany.
  8. February 2019. “Accelerated Analysis and Discovery of Materials”, Invited Talk in the context of the priority programme FLAME at the Institute of Materials Science of the Darmstadt University in Darmstadt, Germany.
  9. January 2019. “Wie Computerchemiker praktischen Chemikern helfen können”, Talk at the Workshop of the Förderverein Chemieolympiade in Düsseldorf, Germany.
  10. November 2018. “Reassessing Pauling’s Rules”, Contributed Talk at the MRS Fall Meeting 2018 in Boston, USA.
  11. September 2018. “Reassessing Pauling’s Rules”, Flash Talk and Poster at the “19. Vortragstagung für Anorganische Chemie 2018” in Regensburg, Germany.
  12. September 2018. “Ab Initio Anisotropic Displacement Parameters of Molecular Crystals”, Contributed Talk at the Symposium on Theoretical Chemistry in Halle (Saale), Germany.
  13. September 2018. “How Computational Chemistry Can Help Crystallographers and Practical Chemists”, Invited Talk at the 3. Meeting of the German Young Crystallographers in Aachen, Germany.
  14. May 2018. “Computergestützte Suche nach neuen Materialien”, Talk for Students at the Boarding School “Internatsschule Schloss Hansenberg“ in Geisenheim-Johannisberg, Germany.
  15. April 2017. “Anisotropic Displacement Parameters from Electronic-Structure Theory”, Invited Seminar Talk of the NAPS Institute at the Université catholique de Louvain in Louvain-la-Neuve, Belgium.
  16. March 2017. “Anisotropic Displacement Parameters from Electronic-Structure Theory: How to Perform and What to Compare”, Poster at the Annual Meeting of the German Crystallographic Society in Karlsruhe, Germany.
  17. January 2017. “Ab initio Auslenkungsparameter”, Talk at the Workshop of the Förderverein Chemieolympiade at the DECHEMA in Frankfurt, Germany.
  18. June 2016. “Fictitious Allotropes of Crystalline Bromine and Iodine in DFT”, Poster at the Workshop “iPolymorphs” at the Materials Physics Center in Donostia, Spain.
  19. March 2016. “Let Them Swing”, Talk at the “Hemdsärmelkolloqium” at the KIT in Karlsruhe, Germany.
  20. July 2015. “Anisotropic Displacement Parameters from Dispersion-Corrected DFT-Methods”, Poster at the “Hands-On Workshop Density-Functional Theory and Beyond” at the Fritz-Haber-Institut in Berlin, Germany.
  21. January 2015, “Intermolekulare Wechselwirkungen in kristallinen Netzwerken”, Talk at the Workshop of the Förderverein Chemieolympiade at the TU Dresden, Germany.
  22. January 2014 “Quantenchemische Untersuchungen intermolekularer Wechselwirkungen des Brommalonaldehyds”, Talk at the Workshop of the Förderverein Chemieolympiade at the Universität Münster, Germany.
